languages.text: "Меня нельзя судить". {n}Кибелла едва шепчет, но слышит ее каждый. Она поднимает мертвенно-бледное лицо. Кажется, будто она спит с открытыми глазами.{/n} "Нет суда, который вправе судить ткача Смерти".

"I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."
languages.original_text: "Меня нельзя судить". {n}Кибелла едва шепчет, но слышит ее каждый. Она поднимает мертвенно-бледное лицо. Кажется, будто она спит с открытыми глазами.{/n} "Нет суда, который вправе судить ткача Смерти".

traits.locale_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}It's barely louder than a whisper, but everyone can hear what Kibellah is saying. She raises her deathly pale face. It's as if she's sleeping with her eyes open.{/n} "No court of law has the right to judge a weaver of Death."

"I cannot be put on trial." {n}It's barely louder than a whisper, but everyone can hear what Kibellah is saying. She raises her deathly pale face. It's as if she's sleeping with her eyes open.{/n} "No court of law has the right to judge a weaver of Death."

"I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "No court of law has the right to judge a weaver of Death."

"I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "No court of law has the right to judge a weaver of Death."

"I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

"I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

languages.text: « Je ne peux pas être jugée. » {n}Pourtant à peine audibles, les paroles de Kibellah sont entendues de tous. Elle lève le menton et vous remarquez que son visage est affreusement pâle, comme si elle dormait les yeux ouverts.{/n} « Nul n'a le droit de juger une tisseuse de la mort. »
languages.original_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

traits.locale_text: « Je ne peux pas être jugée. » {n}Pourtant à peine audibles, les paroles de Kibellah sont entendues de tous. Elle lève le menton et vous remarquez que son visage est affreusement pâle, comme si elle dormait les yeux ouverts.{/n} « Nul n'a le droit de juger une tisseuse de la mort. »

languages.text: «No se me puede juzgar». {n}Las palabras de Kibellah apenas son un susurro, pero todo el mundo las oye. Levanta la cabeza, dejando ver su pálido rostro. Parece como si estuviera dormida con los ojos abiertos.{/n} «Nadie tiene derecho a juzgar a una tejedora de muerte».
languages.original_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

traits.locale_text: «No se me puede juzgar». {n}Las palabras de Kibellah apenas son un susurro, pero todo el mundo las oye. Levanta la cabeza, dejando ver su pálido rostro. Parece como si estuviera dormida con los ojos abiertos.{/n} «Nadie tiene derecho a juzgar a una tejedora de muerte».

languages.text: 「私を裁判にかけることはできない」{n}キベラの発言は囁き声よりわずかに大きい程度だが、その声は皆に届いた。彼女が顔を上げると、その顔は死にそうなほど青白く、まるで目を開けたまま眠っているようだった。{/n}「死の紡ぎ手を裁く権利は誰にもない」
languages.original_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

traits.locale_text: 「私を裁判にかけることはできない」{n}キベラの発言は囁き声よりわずかに大きい程度だが、その声は皆に届いた。彼女が顔を上げると、その顔は死にそうなほど青白く、まるで目を開けたまま眠っているようだった。{/n}「死の紡ぎ手を裁く権利は誰にもない」

languages.text: “没人能审判我。”{n}尽管绮贝菈的声音如同耳语一般，但所有人都听到了。她抬起头，脸色惨白，仿佛睁着眼睛睡着了一样。{/n}“没人有权力审判死亡的织网者。”
languages.original_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

traits.locale_text: “没人能审判我。”{n}尽管绮贝菈的声音如同耳语一般，但所有人都听到了。她抬起头，脸色惨白，仿佛睁着眼睛睡着了一样。{/n}“没人有权力审判死亡的织网者。”

languages.text: "Ich kann nicht vor Gericht gestellt werden." {n}Kibellahs Worte sind kaum lauter als ein Flüstern, aber alle hören sie. Sie hebt den Kopf, das Gesicht totenbleich, als würde sie mit offenen Augen schlafen.{/n} "Niemand hat das Recht, eine Spinnerin des Todes zu verurteilen."
languages.original_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."

traits.locale_text: "Ich kann nicht vor Gericht gestellt werden." {n}Kibellahs Worte sind kaum lauter als ein Flüstern, aber alle hören sie. Sie hebt den Kopf, das Gesicht totenbleich, als würde sie mit offenen Augen schlafen.{/n} "Niemand hat das Recht, eine Spinnerin des Todes zu verurteilen."

languages.text: "Yargılanmam söz konusu olamaz." {n}Kibellah'nın sözleri, bir fısıltıdan çok da yüksek çıkmadığı hâlde herkesin kulağına çalınıyor. Elini kaldırıyor. Yüzüne, âdeta gözleri açık uyuyakalmış gibi ölümün solgunluğu yayılmış.{/n} "Bir ölüm dokurunu yargılamak, kimsenin harcı değildir."
languages.original_text: "I cannot be put on trial." {n}Kibellah's words are barely louder than a whisper, but everyone hears them. She raises her head, face deathly pale, as if she is asleep with her eyes open.{/n} "None have the right to judge a spinner of death."
